sections.title: Syntax
sections.text_content: Draw.FillBox (x1, y1, x2, y2, Color : int)

sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The Draw.FillBox procedure is used to draw a filled box on the screen with bottom left and top right corners of (x1, y1) to (x2, y2) filled using the specified Color. To get a box outlined in a different color, use Draw.FillBox with the Color parameter set to the fill color and then call Draw.Box with the Color parameter set to the border color.
sections.text_content: The Draw.FillBox procedure is used to draw a filled box on the screen with bottom left and top right corners of (x1, y1) to (x2, y2) filled using the specified Color. To get a box outlined in a different color, use Draw.FillBox with the Color parameter set to the fill color and then call Draw.Box  with the Color parameter set to the border color.
sections.mdown_content: The **Draw.FillBox **procedure is used to draw a filled box on the screen with bottom left and top right corners of (*x1*, *y1*) to (*x2*, *y2*) filled using the specified *Color*. To get a box outlined in a different color, use **Draw.FillBox** with the *Color* parameter set to the fill color and then call **Draw.Box**  with the *Color* parameter set to the border color.

sections.title: Example
code:
View.Set ("graphics")
        Draw.FillBox (0, 0, maxx, maxy div 2, 1)
        Draw.Box (0, 0, maxx, maxy div 2, 2)
sections.raw_content: This program will fill the bottom half of the screen with color 1 and then outline it in color 2. The maxx and maxy functions are used to determine the maximum x and y values on the screen. The point (0,0) is the left bottom of the screen and (maxx, maxy) is the right top.
sections.text_content: This program will fill the bottom half of the screen with color 1 and then outline it in color 2. The maxx and maxy functions are used to determine the maximum x and y values on the screen. The point (0,0) is the left bottom of the screen and (maxx, maxy) is the right top.
sections.mdown_content: This program will fill the bottom half of the screen with color 1 and then outline it in color 2. The **maxx** and **maxy **functions are used to determine the maximum x and y values on the screen. The point (0,0) is the left bottom of the screen and (**maxx**, **maxy**) is the right top.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content: The screen must be in a "graphics" mode. See the View.Set procedure for details. If the screen is not in a "graphics" mode, an error will occur.
sections.text_content: The screen must be in a "graphics" mode. See the View.Set procedure for details. If the screen is not in a "graphics" mode, an error will occur.
sections.mdown_content: The screen must be in a "*graphics*" mode. See the **View.Set** procedure for details. If the screen is not in a "*graphics*" mode, an error will occur.

sections.title: Status
sections.raw_content:
Exported qualified.

This means that you can only call the function by calling Draw.FillBox, not by calling FillBox.
sections.text_content:
Exported qualified.
This means that you can only call the function by calling Draw.FillBox, not by calling FillBox.
sections.mdown_content:
Exported qualified.
This means that you can only call the function by calling **Draw.FillBox**, not by calling **FillBox**.
